description:
We came in time for happy hour on a Saturday. It was completely empty at 5pm. The bartender was really friendly, and we were happy with our drinks - Vinho Verde and The Matty. She gave me a generous pour of the wine  

Unlike most other bars, Churchill has low sofa seating that really gives it a lounge feel, in addition to regular bar seating. It's spacious and doesn't feel cramped, and you can even reserve sections ahead of time for no additional fee! Probably the biggest plus is that they are dog-friendly  

We plan to come back with our pup sometime!
author: S C.

description:
I came here for a happy hour with a friend last night and I was blown away by the Mezcal Red Hook ($8 during happy hour 5-8 P.M.).

The drinks were smooth, tasty, and made with skill by the awesome bar tender.

It took a little longer than I would've liked to flag down a bar tender despite the bar not being crowded.

Aside from that, I had a great experience and I'll definitely be back!
author: Nima A.

description:
I love this place! I have been both on a weekend night and during a casual weekday happy hour.

It's rustic style interior is what really draws me to it as it creates a cool environment great for any party. Also the bar is spacious which is in itself a miracle. On the Saturday night that I was here, it was pretty packed but it never felt quite too squeezed in.

When I was here last I ordered the El Diablo and it sure was tasty. It was the perfect blend of Tequila with Ginger beer which I was afraid could go awry tasting too much like the beer.

During the Happy Hour it was nice to see everyone at the bar chatting with each other and I could tell the bartender had good relationships with them.
author: Stephen P.

description:
This place looks so cool from the outside. It has so much potential to do better. I like that they have a pool table but it's a simple place. It looks more popular during the day than other bars around here weirdly enough. 
With how dim the place is, they could have more candles.
author: Angela L.

description: Just came here for a quick nightcap. Real chill spot; nice lounge area with couches and tables, pool table in the back. Bartender was friendly.
author: John M.

description: Happy hour from 4-8pm on weekdays, that's the latest HH I've heard of so far in SF. Tons of seating/tables and a good crowd. Drinks were good and strong.
author: Elaine N.

description: Just celebrated my birthday here and was very pleased with the event. The cocktails were tasty, original, and well priced for nice drinks in SF (everything is $12). The only downsides are that the stools at the tables are uncomfortable, and the combination of the loudly playing music, and the screeching people at the next table over made it hard to hold a conversation in my group.
author: OnlyatBrandei S.

description:
The most sugar coated lemon drop I ever had. Don't get me wrong, I loved it. Very divey, very chill and most importantly the drinks are strong and yummy. Plus it's not over price. 

It's a big bar, a lot of space. Great place for big groups. Its right on market-ish near the Safeway, a great neighborhood spot. The bartenders are nice and friendly. Definitely one of my favorites in the Castro.
author: Sandy B.

description: Stopped by here on the way to the airport for a drink. Bartender was a cool tatted gal that mixed some tasty house drinks for us. They don't have food but you can bring from outside or go to the bomb taco place next door. We weren't there long but will be sure to go back when we are back in SF.
author: Super V.

description:
Cool little bar right by the Castro.
When you first walk in you get a dive bar vibe but they have a full cocktail list. The service was fast even on Halloween and the bartender was friendly. I got a piña colada from here just before hitting up the other bars in Castro which was a great start to the night.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
A dive feel at first with the dark wood atmosphere but once your eyes adjust, it's like any deserved famous cocktail bars in the City. Drinks are good and strong here, and reasonably priced for the quality.

Can't go wrong with their versions of classic cocktails (Old-Fashioned, Manhattan, Sazerac, Blood & Sand, etc.). They also have inventive cocktails which are just as good.

Busy-crowded at drinking hours, especially on the weekends with the B&T crowd. Still, I would brave all that at one of my favorite places to drink since friends recommended this spot. After a couple visits my liver was hooked!

Note easy to find too. Located by the Safeway on Market Street near the Castro neighborhood. Also a good spot to start or end a crawl!
author: Peter L.

description: Down to earth vibes with great staff, the bartender was knowledgeable of drinks and held good conversation as it wasn't busy. Decent price drinks for the city, easy access location surrounded by a few good eats. Good for a group, large venue with seating.
author: Lexy C.

description:
Great place to meet up with friends after work or on the weekend - big windows let it great light. They've got a pool table in the back and the decor is cute too.

Best of all the cocktails are really well done. The beer choices are specific and beer lovers love it! It's expensive but they have an awesome weekend happy hour that starts at 2pm! That's hard to find at a place this nice in this city. 

Some bartenders are really sweet and some aren't - either is fine with me but not everyone is okay with a rude bartender like I am.
author: Taylor S.

description:
Churchill is a cute neighorhood spot near Market St. I've been there a handful of times on busy nights and on quiet weekdays and I've always enjoyed the vibe.

The drinks are solid but you know me, I'm very adventurous with food yet I always stick to my Moscow Mule when it comes to drinks. It's not served in a copper mug but at least it's in a mason jar. I like the bar seating area. I also like the pool table area in the back, but be careful when you enter/exit the women's bathroom as the door swings right open exposing everything to those who are playing pool.
author: Yi Z.

description: Jamie is awesome. Never been here and he really spent time to talk me though some cool drinks. You could tell he genuinely loves doing what he does! Also bomb ass pina colada!
author: Stefani C.

description:
One of my friend's neighborhood bars. I don't go to this area much, so I was happy to check out a new bar. The three of us came by on Friday, August 14th around 8:30pm for a round of drinks.

*Resistenza: rye whiskey, Italian vermouth, amer, bitters ($10)
*Old fashioned

I adore the drinks and atmosphere here. Dark and sexy, but still comfy. We were able to find a table in the corner with was perfect! I love nights with good drinks and company.

Good stiff drinks. And at $10 each?! I'll be back.
author: Elena N.

description: This bar has one of the best bartenders you'll ever see. Give him any sort of hint of your favorite drink and he will make you something amazing. Also, great music.
author: Daniel O.

description:
I don't even know where to begin! 
I just got married and my husband and I wanted to hold our happy hour style reception some where we frequent and love. We wanted quintessential San Francisco. I reached out to Churchill to at first inquire about availability at The Office for our date. Unfortunately, The Office was reserved, but Jacobo (events coordinator) quickly let us know that Churchill was available. And just like that we were off. Jacobo was so responsive and made the whole coordinating and planning of a wedding reception a breeze. To top it off - prices were extremely reasonable!
Day of wedding the owner, Adrian, was there assisting our group and was amazing as well. He was so helpful and available. Adrian stayed calm cool and collected even when our guests bombarded the bar!
Seriously - this location, these two guys and the Churchill staff were a dream. It really was one of the best days (and party) I've ever been involved in.
I would definitely recommend Churchill as an event space for anyone looking for a San Francisco venue!
author: Sam K.

description: Went there once by myself and really enjoyed the drinks and place. Good drinks and good beer, one of the bar tenders was really nice and even let me request music which usually I don't expect at bars. The other bartender, however, did not like it and said I wasn't allowed to choose anymore songs after I requested a song from The Prodigy which made people in the bar bob their heads to, so I think she just has bad taste in music or was jealous.
author: John T.

description:
We celebrated bdays with colleagues post-work there and it was a hit!

Ben made reservations in advance and they saved the best seats in the house for us. Not to mention, their HH rocks! Beer on draft is only $4 and served in a mason jar. Doesn't everything taste better in a mason jar?

I got the green flash passion fruit for the first time and it was incredible! One downside is the wait at the bar at 6pm on a Friday. There were only three bartenders, which is odd for a busy night. Be patient, the best is yet to come!
author: Nitar L.

description:
Discovered this place on a first date many moons ago and I asked my then date, "Did you choose this place because of less straight male competition?"

Here again today so I guess I've looked back since ...
author: Bailey N.

description:
Can't complain. Good amount of room, I liked their different kinds of music 80% of the time (it's a REALLY different mix of a lot of DIFFERENT types),  comfy couches, bar and tall tables.  

I wasn't drinking at the time, so I just got water and a diet coke... I will have to say... their lemons are like... meyer lemons or something because they were really good, sweet-  like meyers. haha

Cool, minimal type of decor. 

Kind of hipster, but cool for low key, but this was during the day.
author: Meena N.

description: Dropped by on a Saturday night and the place was packed. I ordered the blood orange gose beer that tasted sort of sour, but was quite smooth. Place was really dark and it was difficult to hold a conversation because it was so loud. Overall, a good vibe from the place and everyone in our group enjoyed themselves.
author: Edward W.

description: Churchill accommodated our last minute wedding reception beautifully. They were polite and professional in all our communications and we had such a fantastic time we stayed longer than we should have. Great drinks, good service. Thank you, Churchill
author: Evan M.

description:
My friend and I walked over right after having dinner at Chow, and apparently we made it just in time for Happy Hour at Churchill which is between 4PM and 8PM on weekdays. There is tons of open space and huge tables. Apparently Churchill is also an events space, which got me thinking about future events I want to host here...

Anyways, we ordered cocktails that tasted a little too sweet, syrupy, and weak for my taste. The service was good though and the vibe is awesome. This place is good for groups with its large tables and couch seating along the windows. It's right next to the Church Muni station. Not much else to say except meh.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Major attitude and just very unwelcoming even though I brought a large group and we were among the only people. I will not return to be treated with so much negative attitude again.
author: Matt H.

description:
ADRIAN!!!

No...I'm not quoting Rocky here.  I'm just giving props to Adrian at Churchill, who's probably my favorite bartender in SF, who also happens to sling drinks at one of my favorite cocktail lounges in SF.

Adrian made me an absolutely delicious custom gin creation with cucumber and mint -- reminded me a bit of an East Side Rickey, and was perfect on an unseasonably warm San Francisco day.

I didn't think anything could get better than the gin drink, until he made me a classic Aviation cocktail (gin, maraschino liqueur, crème de violette, and lemon juice).  I haven't had a lot of Aviations before, so I might not be the best judge -- but this one knocked my socks off.  So much flavor, so much smoothness.  Yum.

Another thing: I **love** the decor of the place.  Love the ropes everywhere and antique touches.  It's like my fantasy living room.  There's also a pool table in the back.  (Upon further reflection, I realized that no one was actually playing pool.  The local clientele were mostly leaning against the pool table while flirting with one another.)

Needless to say, I love this place.  Thanks to Churchill and its equally boozy neighbor right around the corner (Blackbird), the corner of Church & Market might be the best place to imbibe in all of SF right now!
author: David G.

description:
Churchill has got prime real estate going for it, given its intersection location.

It also has some prime real estate within it. The entire left side is lined with plush coaches, which my friend and I could not find a space to squeeze ourselves onto. They have a few tables (including a pool one) on the right, along with the usual bar seating. Otherwise there is puh-lenty of standing space. Ah, and I should mention that they have the heaviest stools in the history of bar-kind.

Yelpers recommended the $9 BEES KNEES made with tanqueray gin, lemon, honey, and creme de violette. As my friend put it, it tasted more like a grapefruit than a lemon, yet still retained a sharp, acidic flavor.

He got the $9 JIMMY ROSE, which was rye whiskey, apple-infused brandy, lemon, grenadine, and nutmeg in a glass with a big ol' ice cube. What the heck was the white shredded stuff on top? We couldn't figure it out, but I liked his drink more than mine. Perhaps the melting ice cube helped ahaha.

Menu from the evening:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/churchill-san-francisco-3?select=IVX7klOCOv2pZ36u9ix9iw#IVX7klOCOv2pZ36u9ix9iw
and
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/churchill-san-francisco-3?select=IVX7klOCOv2pZ36u9ix9iw#gIP3qZcS-iVFKCGs4Rkegg

Cocktails/beer/wine listed on their website: http://www.churchillsf.com/pdf/menu-cocktail-beer.pdf

They have a $1-off-everything happy hour before 7 PM. It's $20 minimum for credit card, but they'll close on $18 :)

Good drinks, good space, and sought-after sofa seating. And if you can't nab a sofa, you can jumpstart your arm day by moving some of their kiloton stools.
author: Adele F.

description:
A great spot! I recently rented out the upstairs venue for a private event and it couldn't have been more successful. First I want to take recognition to the drinks: the range of drinks offered was outstanding, and they were absolutely delicious. The bar tenders put on a great show and were interactive with our guests, it was the perfect scene. 
The space layout was flexible to our needs, was a bonus. 
My only downfall were the TV and projector quality - if the focus of an event or an evening is situated around their scenes, i'd advise some repairing. However, the speakers distributed throughout the venue made for great sound and atmosphere. 
Overall, great. Very happy and would go back for a night out or another event.
author: Kristen L.

description:
If you're into self entitled "hipsters" who treat their patrons like poo on the bottom of their shoe, then this is the place to go. Went here for a celebratory drink for a friend's birthday and asked the bartender if he had any birthday shots he liked to create for fun. He promptly responded with a cold "This isn't Chevy's," and walked away. Churchill should really reevaluate their staff choices if they want customers to come back. The bartender's sheer rudeness will deter anyone from returning unless physically forced to. 
Additionally, when asking other other patrons at the pool table if we could play a game after them, they all but flat out refused. Will definitely come back if I want to put myself through condescension or if I generally want to have an uncomfortable time.
author: Julia K.

description: Came here for my boyfriend's birthday. It was quite the location. I loved how it was so close to castro, and the prices were not too bad either. Loved the decor. And although they serve 3 bar snacks which compose of jerky based treats, they are super chill with you ordering food and eating it there with their drinks. We had a good group of 10+ or so and we all tried their happy hour drinks. My favorite drink has to be the swizzle, it's 1) beautiful 2) tasty 3) TASTY! It's really hard for me to find good drinks since I like them sweet and tasty, the swizzle has mint in it so the taste came out to be very similar to a mojito which I loved!!!! Not much parking here, so be sure to come early to look for street parking.
author: Amy Y.

description: Love this bar! Dog friendly and yummy cocktails -My two favorite things! Great location, easily accessible by Bart, great place to meet up with friends
author: Angie S.

description: I am a fan of this local hang out with lots of room for groups. Located on a busy intersection corner, Churchill delivers a fun open casual beverage stop which feels so fresh because of the very large windows - see the bustling city outside while you enjoy a very well made old fashioned and chat with friends. The beer selection is good and bartenders are professionals, great eating choices in walking distance including a great Thai place 2 doors down or Chow or Woodhouse just across Market Street. Large lounging couches long tables, and very long bar to what ever may suit your mood. Pool table in back, good juke box choices to add to an already good time at Churchill. Three and a half smiles!
author: Lisa S.

description: Your doorman suck i'll never go to your bar again much rather go to Lucky 13 or the pilsner then your piece of shit bar
author: Marl R.

description:
Favorite bar in the city. Great drinks, great atmosphere, super friendly bartenders, pool table in the back!

Patrons manage to seem good looking *and* hip at the same time. I find this to a be a San Francisco rarity.
author: Jessica P.

description: Dark, crowded and loud but not in a terrible way. I wouldn't go there by myself or on a date but it would be a fun stop for a group, especially for their Happy Hour.
author: Yad L.

description: Perfect neighborhood bar. Their happy hour (M-F 4-8pm) is full of great cocktails and wine/beer options.
author: Lara H.

description: Looking for a place to avoid the Super Bowl. Walked forever past bars closed for private parties or too crowded. Decided to head to Holy Water's big sister. What a great choice. No cover. Not too crowded. Great drinks. Happy hour till 6. Gratis make your own Nachos. Great bartender. Great space. Add another loved space in the city.
author: Vicky W.

description:
Chill, dimly lit bar setting with nice cocktail drinks to be enjoyed here! 

It's a speakeasy vibe here. 

A few of the tables are poorly angled for watching the TV - especially if you want to watch a sport's game, such as the Giants in the World Series, happening!

They have a nice side, wooden lounge and a pool table to play!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Good beer and cocktails, good location.  Lots of other options nearby so great place to start or finish an evening.
author: Drew R.

description: Love the bartender who is working tonight.  We come here a lot and she is my favorite. Always polite, attention to details and makes us want to stay longer.
author: Brad B.

description: An epic SF bar known for it's excellent cocktails/ drinks! Upon the recommendation of my sister ad brother-in-law who live in the neighborhood, I went with friends for post-dinner drinks = amazing! Note: the bartender had some holiday drinks on the menu that were perfect for after dinner! I plan to return here on a future trip to SF!
author: Chiara M.

description: The Jimmy Rose was excellent. Not really sure what theme they are going for given the eclectic music selection (rock to hip hop to throw back 90s), but I loved every minute of it.  Reminded me of Blackbird down the road.
author: Rob M.

description: The place was empty....then again it was monday.... it was pretty chill and comfortable
author: Guadalupe E.

description:
Cool, dark vibe. The portrait of Winston Churchill and the large painting of the American flag (pre-Hawaii/Alaska) spurred a lively discussion of the policies pf the last 30 or so U.S presidents.

I enjoyed my pear cider.
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
Have you ever gone on a mediocre date with the same person twice? Let me clarify... there's nothing wrong with the person. They're attractive, friendly, etc. - but somehow you just don't gel. The chemistry is simply not there. That's kind of how I feel about Churchill.

I've been here a couple of times now for happy hour. Since it was earlier in the evening, the place was kind of quiet. It was just me, the bartender, and a few regulars. Pedestrians walking by must have assumed I was a bar fly.

The first time I came in, I ordered a $6 drink. I handed the bartender a $10, and he never came back with any change. In retrospect, I should've asked for my change. But then again, I didn't want to come across as cheap. But still... a $4 tip for a $6 beverage seems a bit outrageous.

The second time I came in, I had a similarly bizarre experience. I saddled up at the bar, and the first thing the bartender said to me was that they didn't have any beers on tap because something or another wasn't working. Um... ok. No biggie. Besides, I don't drink beer anyway. So I went ahead and ordered a Fernet Branca. The bartender then asked if I had tried this new version of Fernet that had just hit the market. I said I was game, and he poured me a shot. The drink was fine. But for $8 a pop, it wasn't exactly happy hour pricing. Since I didn't want to repeat the tipping snafu of my previous experience, I handed the guy my credit card. The bartender gladly accepted it and then as I started sipping my drink, he revealed to me that there was a $20 credit card minimum. Um... excuse me? This info would've been really helpful a few minutes earlier (before I had placed my drink order.) So what started out as a quick happy hour, suddenly turned in to a $20 tab. 

As I mentioned before, Churchill is a perfectly decent bar to grab a beverage. But there's just something about my two interactions here that have rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe it was just me. Maybe I'm too picky. In any case, I wish them the best of luck. I just don't think I'll be asking for another date any time soon.
author: Kevin B.

description: Gorgeous interior with every gin under the sun. Delicious drinks and fancy atmosphere. The food is decent considering this is foremost a bar.
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
It was some time back in May when I came to SF for a visit and happened to be in this neighbor for my mani pedi. 

It was still freezing so my husband and I decided to have a drink or two at this joint on my way to the salon. We came in around 4:30pm, there were about 5-6 others. It's not noisy so I can enjoy my drinks while chatting up with my husband. The place has its own vibe that's different from the city outside. It's a little hidden gem!

I'd recommend you check it out at nighttime.
author: Hay H.

description:
I can't even keep track of how many iterations this bar has had over the years. I lived in Berkeley for a year and it was closed at first, then it was the "Bar on Church" for a short time, and I think by the time I moved away it was something else.

I came back to the bay area two years later, and it was something else still... and then closed again, and then open again. And NOW it's Churchill, for the last little bit of time.

Seriously, every city has that one corner that seems a prime location and can't seem to make it work. This must be that place.

Finally last night I popped in, half-afraid of getting too attached to a place again, only to see it go away. This time it seems that they may have a little traction. Just judging by the crowd. It was a Tuesday, and by the time we left (9pm) it was pretty busy with what appeared to be mostly locals, mixed gay-straight crowd, mixed male-female crowd. Not bad.

Hope it survives. The servers were friendly and the drinks reasonable. We'll see...
author: Sean B.

description:
Went here on President's day since Elbo Room was closed.  I'll admit that when I walked in I was slightly off-put by the interior.  It's extremely dark and there was almost no one inside (albeit it was a Monday afternoon).  However, I'm very glad I didn't judge this book by its cover.

Churchill is a military themed bar with decor and drink names that echo a World War 2 vibe.  There's big couches for lounging, but the extremely dim lighting kind of fought against our ability to chill and carry a conversation.  I was very impressed by the attention to detail in everything I came across and I recognizing the lighting was more of a personal problem since no one else seemed to mind.

Drinks: We both ordered the Marshall plan.  This cocktail, from their suggested cocktails list, is a mix of Mt. Gay rum, pumpkin-apple cider, ginger beer, and lemon.  For ten dollars this cocktail is well-priced given it's quality ingredients (and it's strength, one was enough get a small buzz going).  I was impressed by the taste, although in comparison to the other cocktails I've seen on yelp and from other customers I was slightly underwhelmed by the presentation.

As far as service goes there seemed to only be one staff member, the bartender.  Although there was only about eight of us in the bar she seemed in a sort of rush and every time we managed to get her attention she acted like she didn't really have time to talk to us.  Nothing too out of the ordinary it was just slightly difficult to get some information on the drinks.

Next time I'm in the area I'll definitely be back.  There were at least two or three other cocktails I'm itching to try, so I at least have to come back to sample those.  Also, I really want to try their beef jerky, if I hadn't just come from a big lunch I would have ordered them since they looked so appetizing in their huge jar.  If you're in need of a good drink and a place to relax, Churchill may be a solid choice for you.

Til next time, keep eating keep learning.
author: Jason M.

description:
Good Music, good company, friendly bartenders, and Happy Hour till 8 pm. If this place was down the street from my office I would be here every week. The best thing of all this place never really got crowded. One thing that can make a happy hour unhappy if you have to fight through crowds to go to the bathroom and scream at the top of your lungs just to talk to the friend next to you or to spit game at the hottie at the bar (or at least I would assume so...).

I came here early on a thursday with some friends for a going away party and I felt like I was hanging out in someone's living room. I grabbed a cheap cocktail which was mixed nicely. There is not much to say except that you'll have a good time at this gem a block away from MUNI.
author: David C.

description:
I guess it all depends on when. I've been a million times but after tonight, after a Giants game, I WILL NEVER GO BACK.
I brought a couple of people there- and after ordering a couple rounds of drinks, we ordered shots. The bartenders laughed!
Listen, I get it, I didn't want Fireball and bringing 6+ people to the bar, we can't all agree. But when your bartenders give us HOTSAUCE in whiskey, and I have 6+ clients who want to leave bc I have to explain the burning- what are you going to do? 
Your staff wanted nothing to do with it. Your greenhaired monster laughed at me when I said anything. Like she relished in the fact that I ordered fireball and got what I deserved. 

Good luck. That was so weird and really mean. I wished I could send ppl bc I loved the atmosphere and had a lot of fun there.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Did the holidays leave you with a useless gift card, a pair of tacky argyle socks and a cough that won't seem to go away, no matter how much Emergen-C you jam down your gullet? Well, take a page out of your grand pappy's medicine journal and enjoy a toasty hot toddy courtesy of Churchill. House-infused apple brandy, lemon, ginger, and a splash of searing hot H2o is just the thing to kick those white blood cells into overdrive! 

You can thank me later.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I was here a few months ago w/a friend and had an unforgettable night.  It was so fun, I came back with my BFF.

They play a decent selection of music and the crowd is just right.  

This is what irked me.  I ordered 2 drinks from the Asian bartender and she told me $20.50.  I gave her $25 and she gave me $2.00.  She tipped herself.  What the heck?  I know it's $2.00 but, isn't that my decision?? I ended up leaving her the extra $2.00 cause I felt sorry for her.  Whatever. Keep it.
author: Angelica C.

description: I came here before dinner at House of Prime Rib and had a fantastic mezcal cocktail! Also, its two levels which is nice if you want to somewhat escape the hectic bar area and sit and have a drink with friends. There is also a pool table which is always a plus in my books!
author: Hayley H.

description: Consistently delicious cocktails, roomy space, non-drama people and the owners are always super friendly. Absolutely no reason not to love!
author: Bella S.

description: Amazing cocktails, bartender in with the Oakland Raiders hat was superb. If you're looking for some after dinner drinks this is a great spot!
author: Anthony C.

description:
Brought some friends who were visiting from out of town, and got lucky enough to snag a table. Not an easy feat on a Saturday night!

Everyone enjoyed their drinks, I LOVED the "Bee's Knees." 

It wasn't raining on this visit, but it was still really hot inside, regardless of how many people were there.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Things Churchill has going for it:
- Quality beer selection. Lots of local beers, a bunch of Belgian stuff. Loved the Green Flash Rayon Vert Belgian-style Pale Ale I had! 'Twas brewed with Brettanomyces yeast, yummmm.
- Dim lights, woody interior, clean.
- Comfy little couches to chill on with your bros and drinks. (Hint: stalk the couches to nab them when their occupants leave.)
- Reasonable drink prices.
- The bartenders know how to make some delicious, strong cocktails.
- Prime location at an easily accessible point in Duboce Triangle.

Things Churchill doesn't have going for it:
- Pouring the draft beers into a mason jar. I'm just not a fan of this. The lip of the jar is so thick, and the grooves make for a bit of a messy sipping experience. I guess it looks trendy, though.
- Gets loud and crowded later at night.
- The bartenders can be pretty difficult to hail. Dunno if that's 'cause I'm not standing in a prime location at the bar or unable to muster attention.
- High credit card minimum. Can't remember the exact price point right now, I think it was something like $20? Make sure to bring cash if you're only going to have a few.
author: Jade V.

description: Churchill is at a great location near all the Muni lines (J, N, 24, 22) for drinks to catch up with friends or network!  I came here for a career happy hour with an environmental group.  I got there a little late, but I managed to talk with a few people - and the drink I had was good and strong at the right amount!  This place has lots of windows, table seated areas, bar room, standing area and softer-seated area.
author: Maile N.

description: Absolutely love this place. One of the best in the neighborhood. This is my watering hole, even with the climb back uphill to get home. They have the best cocktails and ambience. An incredible staff in helping me reserve a spot for my boyfriend's birthday, even allowing me to store a cake for the celebration. The coolest of the cool.
author: Genevive C.

description:
The place is beautiful, the bartenders pay attention and though it's pricey, it's not so much that you feel it in your colon.

I visited on an afternoon, but I've been in the evening as well. Both times were great fun, and both times did a try a great variety of beers and some tasty cocktails. They allow food to be brought in and dogs as well.
author: Trace D.

description:
Overall decent bar, but it is never a place that I actively want to go to but rather end up at. The crowd and the space don't usually make for a great night out. It is extremely loud, even when it isn't packed. Always have a hard time having a conversation with anyone, and if they aren't immediately next to me I don't even bother trying. 

The cocktails are pretty good tho. And if you have a friend who enjoys Mezcal, this a place to take them and let them run wild. For entertainment, they have one pool table. Definitely not a bar that attracts people that are really interesting in playing the game, more of the crowd that enjoys playing a relaxed 20 minute game with their girlfriend. The table is also situated uncomfortably close to the walls, making it difficult to shoot from certain sides of the table.

The restrooms are definitely above par.
author: Michael S.

description:
Being a history buff and having visited the Cabinet War Room and the Churchill Museum in London, I had to check out Churchill - a new spot in the Triangle.  Stopped by before heading over to the Red Devil for the Storm Large show, so didn't have time to hang and had only 1 drink.  I would definitely come back here.

The crowd was an interesting mix - and for some reason there seemed to be a lot of short people there.  Not sure why, and I'm only 6' tall, but it seemed like there were only 2 or 3 persons taller than me there and a number of persons that were clearly in the 5' to 5'5" range.  just an observation.

The decor is 40's England WW2 bunker-ish and the drinks hail back to the classic of cocktails.  Beer is served in mason jar like glasses, and martinis/Manhattans/etc are in old school saucer glasses.  Prices were reasonable for SF - $8 for a well poured vodka tonic and $9 for the specialty drinks.  Beer was also reasonably priced.

A good selection - nice range of well to top shelf spirits (a good bourbon selection which always peaks my interest).  And they have a good beer selection to with a variety to please almost any beer drinkers palette.

I'll be certain to come back when I have more time.  

Churchill goes on my SF watering hole list along with Elixer, Alembic, and Black Horse.
author: Jeff H.

description: Friendly staff, spacious but cozy at the same time and great cocktails! It's perfect for meeting friends after work that's not a sports bar.
author: Justine S.

description:
Great spot. 

They have cocktails specials and also a cocktail list. I had the black prince and it was a pretty strong drink , not very tasty though. The crowd is great and the music isn't bad either. 

My friends has the improved whiskey cocktail. 

They also allow dogs so you can drink while you get a dose of puppy love
author: Priyanka P.

description:
"Do you guys do picklebacks?" ... "No." 
"Can I please have a bramble?" ... "We don't have berries." 
"How about a mint julep?" ... "We don't have mint."

What DO you guys have then? How is a bar supposedly known for craft cocktails lacking in anything other than lemons and maraschino cherries? Which by the way, they garnished every drink with, so they all looked (and kind of tasted) the same. I also overheard guys trying to order different beers on tap and they were out of a couple of them.

It wasn't really a problem for me since I usually just drink scotch, and fortunately they had a lot of what I like for decent pricing (just $17 for my Bruichladdich and a Tom Collins for my friend). There's surprisingly a lot of seating, and next to windows that fortunately open in the summer. It's nicely decorated, and could be a nice place to hang out with friends (pool table in the back!), if only they succeeded at being a BAR.
author: Cat N.

description:
Don't you hate it when you order an Old Fashioned and you get one that's brimming with maraschino cherries and big orange slices? 

Thank God there's none of that at Churchill! Their version is true to its original form: whiskey, bitters, sugar, orange peel.  And a BIG ol' ice cube. A very stiff drink that's meant to be sipped slowly a la Don Draper. 

Only after ordering this cocktail, did we realize, Churchill isn't JUST another bar. It's a neighborhood bar where I can get awesome cocktails and not just my default Tanqueray and tonic. And, by awesome, I mean, classic cocktails such as the Corpse Reviver #2 and the Bobby Burns. The cocktail list is presented on a metal clipboard and at only $9 each, is considerably more affordable than other fancy cocktail places in the city. 

If you're looking for something refreshing and citrusy, the Final Flight made with pisco, aperol and cointreau is so easy to drink, it makes me want to order one more (ok, two more!) right away even though I wasn't finished with the one in my hand. 

Superb cocktails, impressive beer list, generous space and a casual,  fun atmosphere (check out the jukebox and pool table in the back!)  oh and before I forget, you can buy Ryan Farr's famous 4505 chicharonnes at the bar.

You'll be sure to find me here on the regular.
author: Janice C.

description:
Good old fashioneds 

Convenient location, decent music, dim lighting. Have been here during the day and enjoyed lighter cocktails. 

Pce love liquor (I hardly even know her)
author: Eunnice L.

description: Great atmosphere, friendly, quick service. The espresso was so-so... a little thin and acrid. Be willing to try other stuff, though. Pastries look amazing.. haven't tried them though!
author: Daniel W.

description: Solid chill vibe bar with great drink options. Great mix of reggae and hip hop music to keep the fun times going. Extra points for being dog friendly
author: Sandeep M.

description:
My favorite "local" bar. This place is much more chill than my other favorite bar, Press Club, but the drinks, location, and people are all amazing. If you live in the Mission/Castro area, this bar is a must visit. 

They don't skip on the alcohol either! Good, strong drinks, great prices.
author: Blake M.

description:
Great bar! I went here for the first time yesterday, around 5PM. My friend was looking at the upstairs event space (The Office) which I highly recommend to rent out. We stopped by for a quick drink and fell in awe of this bar.

Location: easy to find and there was a good crowd walking around, but it was during the day 
Bartender: very nice and attentive, made sure everyone had a drink 
Decor: wooden, rustic feel and there is a pool table at the back 
Drinks: delicious. Need I say more? I have a drink called the Harmon (I think). Tasted like juice but creeped up fast 
Crowd: hipster-ish and a good mix of after work folks. 

Highly recommend, I'll be back!
author: Natasha S.

description: Ambience cool, lots of wood and barn doors. Some dark tables as well as window seats. Bartender knew his business and the cocktail selection was decent. I got the El Grito: tequila, blood orange, etc, and it was good, strong, and a tad bitter. At about 7pm the music jumped up 10 decibels and conversation got difficult. Around the same time it got busy ish for a Wednesday.
author: Kris F.

description:
This is one of THE cocktail bars to visit in San Francisco. The chalkboards on the wall list the current libations to order, but the bartenders here probably know a few hundred more off the menu. I ordered a beer served out of a mason jar, and my friends got cocktails that looked as beautiful as they tasted. 

The clientele consists of a generally younger professional crowd of after work people, cocktail nerds, beer fanatics, pool players, and their friends. It's a fun atmosphere, never too loud, sometimes too crowded, but always fun.
author: Lawrence H.

description:
Churchill has some creative concoctions.
I had a root beer colada and a drink that was smokey at $9 a pop.
It's dimly lit with industrial features and rope across the top.

They have spirits, beer, wine and seasonal cocktails. 
It's a good size space with various seating.
Near Market, on Church, it's also a convenient place to be meeting.

The crowd's a mix of hipster and thirty somethings.
It gets loud so don't go for conversation.
It can be a fun place for some people observation.
author: Kristi G.

description:
Pool table area at the back is awesome, even if we all looked sketchtastically waiting for the ladies bathroom while waiting between shots. May or may not have been hit by that bathroom door a few times too... There's a little ramp up the pool table and there was no one up there, so sacred space if you're hitting up the pool games. 48-star flag at the back, and a jukebox that you have to go talk to the bartender about (confusing?).

I had the homefront, which was a blast o' rosemary and lemon. I did read the review about it being rancid chicken soup, but I enjoyed it. The mason jar definitely worked for me because I'm classy like that.

I'm liking it as a spacious cousin to Blackbird and the crowd seems to be the same with a bit more ladyfolk.
author: Kevin L.

description: This dive is fun! They also play some pretty gangsta rap =). They have comfy couch seating and those giant family style tables with barstools! In the back, they have pool tables too which makes this place fun for groups! I would love to come back with a larger group next time!
author: Cecily B.

description:
Winston Churchill is actuality one of my Favorite "Basketball players"...
Oh wait...He didn't play basket..ball..Oh My bad, That's "Sir Winston Churchill"

The candid handsome Prime Minister of the UK you say?

Well, "Churchill" Itself dedicated to him or Not is a great place with
amazing spirits, ales, cocktails, and magic practicing priest.

Don't believe me...well come here yourself.

The place host a lively bunch straightforward, world-class cocktails in a space that looks like a war time tent slash M.A.S.H. Bar and canteens. 
This place looks like a place you might accidentally catch "Former Mayor Gavin Newsome" In disguise  

http://kfmbam.images.worldnow.com/images/19975429_BG1.jpg

A place for well-traveled diplomat or law man or socialite to go.
Modern enough to be amazing and unpretentious.

This place has an ever changing Menu, I can only assume because of the
seasonal cocktail list that is available. Such like the "Bees Knees" = Gin, Lemon, Honey and the "Monte Carlo" which features an oaken ten year with bitters and lemon.

I've been here once or thrice a few times, enough to know this place is hard to get parking, and it gets pretty packed as instantly favored as a pretty new 
teen to a smart phone and instra-gram. 

Now the drink selection is awesome I would suggest researching the menu
before going, no drink I have had here was ever horrible or ill-prepared,
I guess it depends on your bartender/mixologist but remember to tip
them yeah, they get pretty slammed and will response quicker to kinder-money implied patrons. 

Not alot of spots to sit at, and looks like
the place is reserved to those who come early, 


Clean beautiful Bathrooms and good music...
AMAZING PLACE TO PEOPLE WATCH!

Happy hour until 7! check it out!


Pro-tip: since it's hard to find parking in the Area...and this place could be packed
              why not bar hop?, "Residence" and "Blackbird" are in walking distance.
               Give them a go, and if you do...tell me what you liked.
author: Michael R.

description:
Yelped some areas on the robot phone and found Churchill with great ratings!

Ratings correlate to real life experience! :)

Bouncer out front was friendly - thumbs up.
Bartenders were quick, experienced and good natured - double thumbs up!!!

Ordered a French 75 with Gin and they served it up nicely. Well balanced with the perfect sweet and tart. Just the way I like it ;)

Ordered a drink off their menu and was superb as well.

I really like the space in here. Good lighting ( dim..the best duh ) and tables spaced out nicely. Good standing room, good bar for leaning aka. flirting :P

Will definitely be back!!
author: Selina W.

description:
Our group made a stop here while waiting for a table across the street at Woodhouse FIsh Co.  It took us a little while to figure out what we wanted to drink, and the bartender was more curt than he should have been, because "other people were waiting," even though the other people that were waiting was our group.

Regardless, Churchill has a nice atmosphere, well poured drinks, and great location.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Fun time w/ the BFF here. Not sure if she's been here before but this past weekend was my first time.

It's rather dark in there but hey, what bar isn't? Very nice, cool, hip crowd. Bathroom is surprisingly spacious and clean. Then again, we came early.

The drinks are good. I kept ordering the Homestead which is a very tasty alkie-infused lemonade. Darn thing is a creeper. BFF had Macallan all night but beware - they don't have the 18 here. 

Drinks are reasonably priced. Look out for the cute redhead bartender - she won't cheat you. My BFF bought the first round from the Asian bartender and she said the drinks were $20.58. BFF handed her $25 and only $2 came back. She wasn't too pleased w/ that. Nope.
author: Julie L.

description:
i kinda love this cocktail bar. it's not usually super crowded, and you can get your drinks fast. there are great seating areas, and tv's for watching games! pretty clutch because sf is missing GOOD cocktail bars that appeal to sports fans, i feel like.  

the drinks are deeeelicious! and hard to stop yourself from trying literally everything on the cocktail menu, and there are quite a few selections to choose from!  the menu is seasonal though, so you will always be able to try new and different drinks! YUM! also - pizza place super close by in case you shut down the bar :)
author: Christina L.

description:
What every neighborhood needs is a good neighborhood bar, and Duboce Triangle* is fortunate to have Churchill in its' midst.

Conveniently located next to the Church MUNI stop and right next to the 22 stop, Churchill found an underserved area and the locals have responded accordingly. Most nights, at least after Tuesday or so, you'll be hard-pressed to find a lot of seating room at the bar or at any of the myriad couch/table seats. There's room to stand and watch tv, or play pool in the back (suspiciously almost always available) but if you want a seat, get here early or stand around and pounce when you see a spot.

You should stay, though, because the cocktails are made pretty well and the bar itself is really comfortable and easy to hang out in. Music is played at a volume that means I'm not listening to the person two down from me ramble on about whatever, but I can definitely hear the person next to me. That's an impressive feat!

Drinks are, though, what makes a bar (and not the Kids with Guns playing on the website when I went to verify what else they had) and they have an excellent cocktail selection with a ton of good liquors available (including Buffalo Trace, my favorite bourbon of all time**) as well as good beers on tap and in bottle (including Montana's famous Moose Drool).

Excellent neighborhood bar and a good meeting point if you're trying to find a centralized place where everyone can meet.

* - I don't care if Churchill is probably technically in another neighborhood, I'm completely claiming it for ours. We need it! Don't take this from me.

** - it should be yours, too. It's delicious. And in San Francisco it's perennially bourbon-drinking weather, so you have plenty of time to try it!
author: Danny P.

description:
If you reserve the upstairs like Anna G did for her birthday, this bar is pretty amazing. Even if you're downstairs, it's a pretty happening place. She took over the stereo and let her friends enjoy drinks for three hours. It is spacious and there's a nice view of the city. Bartenders are friendly as well.

The drinks are strong here. I was ready to pass out on the couches upstairs. Prices are about $9 for a cocktail. It felt nice going here when we had the place to ourselves.

Now that I know an upstairs exists, I don't think I'd want to stay downstairs.
author: Amy J.

description: The bartenders are a little bit impolite but the place is cool to hang out and have a beer
author: Raymond R.

description: Nifty, very hipster bar in the city.  Damn, do they make a mean cocktail.  Got an old fashioned and it was done to perfection.  Maraschino cherries and all.  Really liked the atmosphere here too - it's definitely a great hangout place.  It does get pretty packed though!
author: Alyx F.

description: It used to be a great bar, but now it's just a bunch of hipsters who think they're better than everyone else. Putting hot sauce in fireball shots and then laughing about it when people ask them why they did that...yeah, a bunch of d*cks who forgot there's a bunch of great options close by.
author: Nick D.

description:
Craft cocktails approved. Had the Improved Whiskey cocktail. Good for Old Fashioned aficionados but there is a hint licorice-ishy. I was told there was a splash of absinthe but I could not read/see the cocktail menu at this point of the evening. Our group liked the other selections of cocktails. 

Vibe is good but the space is large enough to retreat to a corner couch if needed

Would add to the repertoire of approved craft cocktail bars.
author: Vivial S.

description: Still wish this place was The Transfer. Which was a dingy, seedy  dirty bar back in the day.  Good bar to go to for a really stiff drink.  Now it's hipster heaven. Gentrification at it's finest.  Sad to see a staple bar in the Castro turn to shit.
author: Ina H.

description:
This is a VERY over rated bar. The first time here I experienced shitty service and equally shitty hipster douchebag/start up bro patrons. Well I made the mistake of coming back to give it another chance this evening with friends. Once again (this time with hardly anyone there) shitty service. The bartender acted like she had a stick up her ass and if you dared ask her a question or tried to be friendly, she just gave strange looks and even had the nerve to roll her eyes once because I asked for the cocktail menu that she quickly took away. Yes, I did want to look at the menu again and order a different drink, but god forbid someone change up their drink order for the next one, why does that justify attitude when I was friendly and polite?!  

Honey, lose the attitude and get a better personality. Have fun serving up start up douchebag bros, because that is all you will ever be doing in this town while they walk over you like a door mat.
author: Joda L.

description: Okay cocktails. Not expertly crafted but better than a dive. Crowd is a mix. The toothless barback is super rude. I would be bummed if he became a bartender.
author: Cathy L.

description:
NYE 2013. Haven't been here since it was The Transfer forever ago. Champagne in those old school glasses, y'know, the ones in Indiana Jones with diamonds and the singer in a red dress. 

Wish I could've heard what songs were playing, but not a single drunk girl spilled some sloshy sugary beverage on my shoes, and the people that were they were pretty cool to mingle with. Y'know, the usual suspects - hot Muni drivers, attorneys, army men. Fun times.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I love this place. I'd started with the cider and that was no bueno, so I graduated to their delicious cocktails. I tried a few of them and they were all really yummy, not too sweet.. and really strong. Everything's really reasonably priced, $9 cocktails, like $6 beers? Really casual atmosphere, kinda hipster chic, friendly.

Conveniently located right off the N Judah too.
author: Vivian H.

description: Love this place! Happy hour until 8pm is the best! The bartenders always provide great service and the cocktails are delicious! It's a pretty warm atmosphere and there is a pool table that you can take advantage of! :)
author: Christina A.

description: Laid back cocktail bar. Generic bar type decore / atmosphere. They bump some hard hip hop beats and have a variety of strong and seasonal cocktails. Mid twenties crowd. ~$10 a cocktail. Gets packed and bar staff general decent at accommodating everyone. Don't expect outstanding service. Pool table in the back.
author: J. M.

description:
Crafty.

Creativity: Yes, there is creativity and craftsmanship all over here.
Value: Subjective, it's like buying art.
Selection: Crafts and locals, no generic yellow beers here.
Service: Friendly and Prompt
Quality: excellent ingredients.
Atmosphere: Chill to upbeat lounge.
Decor: Urban lofty with a hint of sea ship

What I had: Drinks, shots, and beer at the bar all while phone was charging at a convenient outlet.

Conclusion: I'd go back with a group.
author: Steve L.

description:
I think Churchill is a perfectly okay bar. Think of it as "Bloodhound #2 SW."

Stopped by for drinks on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't too crowded which is good for getting your drink on. I remembered the old space being quite dark but it was perfectly light and airy on a nice weekend afternoon. Love the wide range of beers on tap and prices weren't that bad. $5 for Ranger IPA served in a mason jar - again the Bloodhound similarities. 

All in all it's a decent bar in the neighborhood that can be a good alternative to Blackbird when it gets too crowded. Will be back for happy hour.
author: Jon L.

description:
Good fratty local bar. 

This is a decent bar - kind of fratty, but they have decent cocktails for $10. Its lively, but not too crowded.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This bar is rather interesting.  Hard to peg into any one category.  It rocks a cold aesthetic that says "designed to keep you drinking and then get you to leave".  What I mean is it's pretty hard to love but nice to enjoy.  It's not very comfortable, gets relatively packed, and isn't really dive bar-esque.

The giant American flag inside makes me uncomfortable because I'm not having a drink to celebrate america... That much is for sure.  What they lack in aesthetics they make up for with killer mezcal cocktails and a bartender who has served me a full shot of angostura on the house before, just to try it.

At this point in my review the dedicated reader of my prose might recognize that this review is a bit scattered, and indeed this is a reflection on Churchill itself.  I love their mezcal cocktail, have played a fair amount on their pool table, don't mind their gimmicks, and yet I seem to bring friends here and half enjoy it and the other half find every part of Churchill repulsive.  For those who are cynics, the aesthetics, the mason jars, they all wreak of something too commercial and unwholesome.  For myself this place holds a special place in my heart because everything I just described is distinctly Churchill and nowhere else, which leaves it's seeds planted in your memory.
author: Alex H.

description: Good drinks, nice ambiance and solid location!
author: Janette W.

description:
Been here several times now for all sorts of occasions and non-occasions, and I'm definitely a fan. It can get crowded: arrive early, or go on a weekday, and you'll have no wait. Later on you will have to hover to find a table or couch or seat at the bar. This place has TVs to watch the game, as well as a pool table in the back. My favorite part of the decor is the ropes hanging from the ceiling. It all recalls a 1940s vibe (as proudly stated on their website) - and I would agree. That era is one of my favorites in history, so I admit it may contribute to my fond feelings.

Of course they have draft and bottled beer, and a few "we better have some wine" selections. But - let's be real - it's the cocktails that really propel this place towards the top of my go-to drinking establishments near my 'hood list. You can order a standard G&T, but why don't you let the bartenders work their magic and give you something a little more interesting. The classics are a must here. And (unlike their neighbor around the corner - which is one of my favorite bars in SF) they take credit cards. Enjoy.
author: Allison B.

description: The drinks we ordered were all delicious. I liked the feel of the bar. Extremely busy when we went in. Service wasn't that friendly and it was SO incredibly loud I could barely hear what the bar tender was saying or what my friends were saying. I also kept getting nudged constantly in the back/side by other patrons. It was much more enjoyable later in the evening once people started leaving. I'd come back to get a drink in the future if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
author: Kelli H.

description:
I was in my old hood and decided to stop in and have a drink!

 It was weird not to see the old 'Transfer" here..I remember back when I was a kid walking home from school, I would peek in through the dutch door just too see what was going on a run off and giggle....I couldn't explain why people would sit there and laugh and drink!? Oh wait, I get it now!! LOL

Anyway, so I walk in and it looks fabulous in here....It's not a dive bar at all. Everybody is dressed casually but not trashy or bummy. The crowd was good. Bartenders were nice and the drinks were also good. I also noticed that they have a pool table in the back or wait or is it 2? I don't remember...too many mojitos. The decor is very nice and also have an area on the side with couches and a lounge'y area...I will def come back if I am in the mood to veg out and kick it!
author: Carla F.

description:
Environment- Dark woods, perfect lighting, and talented bartenders/mixologists/drink makers. Volume level varies based on where you are in the bar, far left is more intimate with cushy seats, and far right is loud by the pool table and group seating. Gets packed on the weekends and later at night. There's an (amazing/expensive) pool table in the back, but it's a little jammed in there, especially when the bar gets packed.  

People- like a Venn diagram, it attracts different crowds with similar interests. Date nights, slightly agro bro packs, friendly groups out for birthdays on their first stop of bar crawls, gaggles of post-sorority girls who are cool and SF now, spillover from the edge of the Castro (still hip but not wild). 

Protips- I know you want to bring your OkCupid date here, but it's loud enough that I would wait until the 2nd or 3rd.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Interesting decor!  (Sort of nautical but definitely not a dive.) Bouncer and bartender were appropriately friendly-ish.  One table of billiards, plenty of semi-squishy seating. 

The lighting was pretty dim and my kamikaze was a kamikaze.  I did very much like the large, open windows that overlook Market, though.  Perfect for people-watching as well as the defenestration of the lime garnish of my cocktail.

Some remark that it is 'fratty' here.  I did indeed notice dudes in striped button-downs rather than plaid-button downs, so I guess this could be true.  Although, when I went to powder my nose the guys at the pool table were kind enough to pause the game to let me sneak past to the door with 'SCURVY WENCHES' emblazoned upon it.*

As appreciation of this courtesy, when exiting the powder room (which was actually complete with a powder keg) I cracked the door ajar and opened it slowly so it made that sweet haunted house creak before I peeped my head out to make sure I wasn't going to whack a bro when I made my grand exit.

Overall pretty excellent; I shall return.

*The door doesn't actually say that.  Pretty sure it just says Ladies. But wouldn't the alternative be cooler? Plus it would go with the theme.
author: Pernicious J.

description:
Went to Churchill last night for the first time and wasn't really that thrilled. Although the roped ceiling was really cool and I loved the look of the drinks, the bartenders IGNORE YOU. The extremely tall one stood directly in front of my eyes for about 20 minutes without acknowledging my existence. Very rude and WEIRD!

Also, not wild about the location. I find it kind of odd to have so many open windows at this busy intersection. You become very aware of the unique aromas wafting in from the street. Pretty gross! 

I would probably come back sometime and give it another shot, as I have friends who live around the corner, but this is definitely not my spot of choice...
author: Jasmine M.

description: Love this bar people and bartenders give it a great vide! Been to San fransisco twice and came here both times! Highly recommended place to go!!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Not exactly sure why people love this place.  Not a lot of seating (once you get a hold of a set of leather couches, worth high-fiving all your friends). and not a lot of service unless you squeeze yourself between people sitting all around the bar.

If you don't love beer, might not be worth trekking all the way down here. They do have a torrontes wine, which is rare but delish.
author: Alice Z.

description:
There are many good things in the Castro. This is near the top of that list for the following reasons:

- $1 off everything during happy hour
- Restoration Hardware-esqe interior with wood panels and filament bulb lighting
- awesome bartenders who make a good a playlist as they do drinks
- on the city's main drag and close to transit

There's always a good number of different styled beers on tap. I am impressed by the cocktails. The Homefront is well touted for good reason, tasting of spiked lemonade.

tab is $20 minimum
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Churchill is an overall okay bar. Not one of my favorites, but never a bad experience. It can get a bit too crowded for my tastes on the weekend, but for a weekday drink after work, it's pretty ideal - central location, good cocktails, mixed crowd. 

I once went to a party in the upstairs space ("The Office") and it's a cool venue for 50 or so people.

When it comes down to it though, I usually prefer Blackbird (better cocktails) or The Residence (less crowded). But that's just me!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
A really nice place to stop by and grab a drink off of market. It is across from the Woodhouse. Stopped by this place with a group of about four people. It was pretty crowded on a Saturday night but we were able to get our drinks pretty quickly. We also got lucky and found a table as people were leaving. 

I just want to describe the clientele with one quick story. We were sitting there and enjoying our drinks catching up with someone beside us dropped their drink and it shattered all over the floor. One of the guys yelled party foul and slapped me on the back asking if I agreed. He also shook me and said "what up bro?" Ugh what up bro indeed. The guys proceeded to push their feet around in the alcohol spreading it and making jokes and slapping each other all over.  I avoid this by not going to the Marina but sometimes it leaks out all over the city. 

The drinks were decent, didn't get a chance to try any of the cocktails. Liked the look of the place it was great lighting and a convenient location. I don't go out in the area much so don't know the better alternatives. But you could do worse and likely better than Churchill.
author: Nick R.

description:
Who likes waiting in lines? No one, that's who. But when it's a buddy's birthday and this is the spot he chooses for his celebration, I'll deal with it. It makes it better that the guy at the door was nice and felt bad about it... made me feel like maybe it really was a saftey/fire code requirement instead of those cheesy bars/clubs where they make you stand in line for looks only to find it dead inside. I hate that! 

Anyhoo, once we finally got inside I was rewarded with an absolutely fresh and delicious gin greyhound, which melted my line-waiting woes away pretty quickly. Although it certainly was crowded, it was much more manageable toward the back of the bar near the pool tables, and made for a fine evening with friends. 

While perhaps I wouldn't choose to come here on a busy night again, I do like the vibe of the place (comfy, rustic, friendly) and enjoy its tasty drinks, so I'm glad to have found a potential middle of the week meet-for-drinks location!
author: Christina P.

description: Solid ambiance. Drinks are a cut above. Little heavy on the syrups/bitters, light on the liquor based on what I observed from pours. Low point of the evening was the busser tossing fruit on the table into unfinished drinks of those of us playing pool then starting to walk away.  Just no. At least replace the cocktails.
author: David G.

description:
Great place. I love the environment, the bartenders, the strong cocktails, the traditional style of preparing the drinks. Gahd. I almost don't want to write this review simply because it would be like spilling my best-kept secret. I love this place. 

What can I say, I'm just an Old Fashioned kinda gal, and this place makes them perfectly. ;)
author: Rosavida C.

description: Exceeded my expectations. This place used to be really divey and skeevy but I'm really glad I gave it another chance. Cocktails are a little pricey for me, but they have a nice double on tap. Great aesthetic: loungey, barrels, rope ceiling, a bit like a pirate ship. Would definitely come with friends or possibly a casual date. Diners open late nearby a great plus.
author: Tyler L.

description: Great spot for drinks. A good meeting up place for friends.
author: Grace T.

description: Gotta give a shoutout to Ryan, the bouncer. Watched him handle an obnoxiously drunk person with kindness and grace while standing strong. Super great bar, good people, one of the best in SF
author: Andrew S.

description: Churchill has quickly become one of my favorite spots in San Francisco. As someone who owns a dog, I tend to feel guilty going out but Churchill has made made my life so easy. Great drinks and seasonal beers makes this spot phenomenal. Can't tell you how happy I feel bringing my pup along with me.
author: Paul G.

description:
Its pretty nice inside, but I've always found the staff a a little snooty, enough that I don't really care too much about going back. If someone wants to go there, I go, no questions asked. I don't mind ending up there, but I would never go out of my way to go. 

They have a small selection of cocktails and they are all really strong, but kind of monotone. The beer selection is pretty good, but don't expect much of the everyday stuff. I would say the atmosphere is kind of dull. Everyone's just sitting around in the dark.
author: Dexter H.

description:
The mixed crowd was my favorite part of Churchill.  And--everyone was chill and getting along! 

 The decor is pretty original too.  There is enough space to move somewhat freely without getting pushed or shoved,  The crowd definitely had some class and respect for each other.  

My only suggestion for Churchill  would be to take a good look at their alcohol offerings.  I didn't score too well last night as they do not offer  Dewars or Jim Beam.
You would think that they are pretty standard choices at a full service bar.
However, they did have my third choice--Jameson.  It was served on the rocks in a mason jar.  

I can't believe this place used to be the Transfer.  Does anyone remember the Transfer?
author: Thomas D.

description:
I have no idea how packed Churchill gets on busier nights, but all I can say is that they're off to a great start with expertly crafted cocktails and a chill, relaxed atmosphere.  My Army & Navy with Beefeater, lemon, housemade Orgeat and bitters was fantastic and Michelle L. thoroughly enjoyed her blended scotch cocktail.

So sad that we had to leave sooner than we would've liked to make a dinner reservation, but I'll be back again to make my way through the other signature offerings.
author: Eric F.

description:
__________ has checked in at Churchill.

__________ has checked in at Churchill

__________ has checked in at Churchill

Pamby: WTF is so great about Churchill?

I don't often head over to that neighborhood, even though I usually have good parking karma there.  When the lovely Kristina A planned a DYL here as part of the mini bar crawl, I was stoked.  The crawl started out elsewhere and was going to end here, but I popped in early to see what all the fuss was about.  And a fuss it was.  There was a bouncer at the door carding people.  It was already pretty packed, people hovering like vultures for seating.

To be fair, I think this place would be significantly more awesome with less people.  The decor reminds me of someplace the infamous "Brandy" from song would work, with old ship type (and possible Ikea or CB2, wasn't going to rule it out) furniture.  The drink list is quite extensive and the booze is nothing to sneeze at.  I don't recall the staff being especially fabulous but it WAS pride weekend and it WAS insanity.

I draw the line at having to stand in line to get in.  I'm too old for that.  I'm also too old for the crowd, average age 21.5.  Once the new wears off, this is definitely a place to get settled in and watch the ships go buy.
author: Pam S.

description:
FIVE stars for a place to have a happy hour drink, prior to the evening crowd. 

Great meeting place where several of the MUNI trains meet up nearby (Duboce/Church for the N & J lines and Church Station for K, L, & M lines). 

THREE stars once it gets busy, unless you have ridden the wave that took it up three notches in volume. 

I am happy they usually have at least one Saison on tap, as that is my beer of choice these days. As for the cocktails, go for it - they are made well and are tasty:) 

FYI: $20 card minimum
author: Brooke C.

description:
Nice interior, great location. 

Bar tenders are rude and unpleasant. The crowd has a Marina vibe. And what's up with the 20$ min on a card?
author: Jhon T.

description:
Me: Hi, I'd like a dirty martini, please. Big and dirty.
Bartender: You want to try a real martini? It's different than what people consider as a "martini."
Me: ..Yes I want a real martini!

AMAZING, but super fruity. So then I got a dirty martini. And it was AMAZING. 

Had cute dudes. And the Giants on TV. This is kind of my new favorite bar.
author: Emily D.

description:
Adrian! Best bartender I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. My family and I were in town for my birthday and decided to stop in on this random bar. They had just opened and Adrian was sitting behind the bar, prepping for the day. He greeted us so kindly and immediately served us delicious drinks with an education TO BOOT! I now know everything there is to know about whiskey and what type of vermouth I like. Great, personable guy who's passion for spirits is easily observable. 

Oh and cool atmosphere. But overall, thank you Adrian! You completed my birthday :)
author: Sarah S.

description:
The drinks are good. The list of drinks was interesting from what I remember. Then again, I tend to like sweet drinks full of tequila - you know that's my drink of choice always. 

The space is great - some couches and some tables. I just don't think there's enough tables and people tend to take up lots of space on the couch you know? Just not enough tables I think. 

Strong drinks, close to public transportation? I'm in.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Wow, this place is beautiful. I can't believe this used to be The Transfer / BOC. It's been transformed from cracky and tweaky to THIS (see photos I pilfered and uploaded from haighteration.com).

Officially opens tomorrow.
author: Jack R.

description: Worst service ever, even with the understanding of it being a holiday.  The bar tenders were few and far between.  The owner was there in a vampire costume and immediately had his bartenders serve himself and his friends before very long lines on paying patrons while loudly boasting.... We preordered $20 tickets to find that the door cover was $10....  They are slinging drinks under the guise of craft cocktail establishment. There are way too many other choicest not the immediate area to find yourself at this sorry place.
author: Kimberly K.

description: I did some day drinking here and it was awesome. I agree with other reviewers in that its very crowded and the bartenders are a little snooty, but sitting next to the windows with friends and the breeze blowing makes it worth it. Also it does allow dogs, so many cute dogs to pet!
author: A.K. M.

description:
Ahh, my Churchill dilemma.  Went here with a friend last night knowing that they were known for their cocktails.  Even though I am a dyed in the wool beer/scotch on the rocks guy (read: I'm secretly a 75 year old man), I gambled and decided to branch out and order a cocktail.  I asked for the bartender's recommendation, and ended up with some gin and honey and whatever drink, which was solid, don't get me wrong, but I spent the first thirty minutes gazing longingly at the beer taps with a magenta drink in my hand.  

Round #2, asked for the hoppiest beer in the place, got a Sierra Nevada Torpedo Double IPA in a mason jar, and harmony and balance was once again restored to the narrow little world of James S.  Success.

Cool space, awesome couches and big leather chairs by the windows.  We went on a Monday and the vibe was really relaxed, but still happening.  Would definitely come back on a weekend, I bet this is a great place when it gets crowded and rowdy too.

But the best part?  Amazing jukebox.  Insanely good.  Dirty south rap, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, the Very Best of Prince, what more could you ask for.  Grab a drink, play jukebox nazi, text your friends when your jam comes on, sulk in the corner when said texts are ignored, rinse and repeat.  Perfect night out.
author: James S.

description: Five stars to the Asian female bartender who makes a very good (subtle) margarita at warp speed. She's very good at what she does, and very professional under pressure.
author: Inigo M.

description:
typical trendy hipster bar that I both love and hate.  it reminds me of bloodhound in SOMA, except bigger.  

it wasn't crowded on a Wednesday night, but it wasn't empty.  you probably wouldn't have been able to find somewhere to sit, but there'd be plenty of room to stand.  cocktails are apparently their thing, but I got a bottle of anchorsteam ($4) that I didn't bother pouring into the empty mason jar they handed me along with the bottle.  

music was definitely too loud to have a normal conversation... either that or I have awful hearing.  we ended up leaving and heading to the the residence around the corner.  I would've liked to stay, but I couldn't hear a thing.

i'll probably be coming back sometime in the near future to try some cocktails.  I live closer to the ballpark, so Churchill is far, but at least it's RIGHT outside the duboce muni stop.  I left the area around 11:30 pm and had no problem getting back home via muni.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Love coming here. The lone bartender was magnificent with his communication and service with a slightly busy crowd during happy hour. They had Noah's Mill, and the staff is solid.
author: Rafael R.

description: Churchill is a cool bar. When we went there it was hard to find a place to sit, but the atmosphere is nice and friendly.
author: Galya T.

description:
Too legit to quit. 

If I lived in San Francisco, Churchill would be in my top three for watering holes. The decor is simple, but classy. I thought for sure I'd be burning a hole in my wallet over Thanksgiving weekend to drink there with some friends. That SO was not the case. I ordered 5 whiskey-based shots, and the bill came to $30. I about passed out from disbelief and happiness. When I wasn't taking shots, I was drinking the Bee's Knees cocktail - It's gin based, and it's fantastic! The ambiance is good for groups, not so much one on one, I think. Love, love, loved it.
author: Rebecca D.

description: This place is good, decent list of cocktails. I really like the millionario drink here. Bar can get super packed, but the bartenders are efficient. There are tables here as well, which is nice if you can grab one. I do wish this place had a spot to hang coats at the tables. It's located near the Safeway, and can be somewhat sketchy to walk alone outside at night, so try to park close to the bar.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Damn good bourbon old fashioned!  All their bartenders make delicious and strong cocktails. 

Pool table. Clean bathroom. Sometimes a fireplace on tv. Always a good drink. 

One of my favorite bars!
author: Melissa F.

description:
Great place to bring your puppy when you're craving a drink.

I had one of their signature cocktail (bee's knees) with gin and honey. It was delicious, and made well. 

We were there around 5pm on a Saturday and left close to 7. It filled up (not overflowing, just nicely full) with locals/regulars. There isn't a lot of seating here which leaves A LOT of empty space, so I'm going to assume that this place gets packed? I do wish they had a little bit more seating so the place wasn't so BARE.

They also have a pool table. It's not the best quality table or cues, but its $1 a game so the price isn't bad.

All in all, I'm not sure I will be back here, even though the cocktails were good.
author: Courtney S.

description: Really delicious drinks. Cute place. Bitchyest bartender ever!!! Yelp reviews are great. Maybe she wasn't working!
author: Michael F.

description: Dirty tap lines! Sanitation is really bad here. No thank you! never coming back I don't want to catch some disease from your dirty cups.
author: Tiger T.

description:
Came here for a birthday celebration and I must say, it definitely has that swag feel to it. Kind of rusty, classy, with dim lights and lots of hipsters.

The ambiance was great, as the bar shelves were beautifully designed, along with the tasteful wooden high tables and stools. There is also a pool table in the back for free, but there is typically a long waiting list. 

I only tried a few sips of the drinks, and they tasted pretty strong. Although not a fan of over-powering alcohol, hey, at least you are getting your money's worth right?

From what I understand, parking around the area is a bit tough, since it tends to be packed here, and since it's, of course, all street parking. 

Overall, it was a great bar if you are a fan of the dim lights/swanky decor vibe. Check it out for yourself!
author: Luby H.

description:
Churchill has mastered the elusive combination of a chill corner bar paired with professional bartenders who mostly manage to make that perfect cocktail without being pretentious.

Churchill became my corner bar while I lived in the Castro.  Somewhere to meet friends, get a drink and relax.
author: Nicole R.

description: Bartender was NOT a friendly. She couldn't be bothered, even though there were 10 people total in the entire place and we ordered drinks right from the cocktail list. Two stars only because the drink was tasty... and it is a cocktail bar after all.
author: Patrick C.

description:
7-September, Friday:
Fantastic IPA draft ales on tap here, but this place gets quite crowded and loud.

WARNING: It is notorious bear country at Churchill! Not only do you want to reduce the chance of having an unwanted close encounter with a bear, raccoon or field mouse. But you'll also want to be mindful of keeping your food supply safe using the pulley system to hoist it to an untouchable height.
