The drinks were imaginative, the people watching was great, and my seething anger at public transportation was abated.
author: Brian M.

description: A few decent beers (though I would expect more from a bar in SF) and a nice, hipstery space does not make up for the staff trying to kick you out of the bar well before closing time on the pretense that it's "almost" closing time, and chastising me for not drinking my drink fast enough. I'm sorry, but I graduated from college just so I didn't have to chug my beers anymore, and I'd like to sit and enjoy what I paid for.
author: Katie C.

description:
I hate to even give this place one star...when they don't even deserve that. The bartenders here are full of attitude and sure made it clear that they hate their job and wish that they were somewhere else. I will never come back here again, because the service, or lack thereof, was so unbelievably horrible!

To the managers and supervisors, please review your staff. They are unwelcoming to people visiting town (very click-ish), resentful of customers that arrive around midnight, and simply are not hospitable. Meanwhile, they have uncontrollably bad attitude and need to learn to know when to put a cork on it, because my bartender had a very bad mouth. Also, if you have a problem with shrinkage, the same bartender who "helped" me is at least one source as well as the girl with red hair and tattoos all over her body... just a tip.

I came here last night, a little after midnight, to discover an almost empty bar with bartenders angry about more customers walking in for a drink. Excuse me, but you are open until 2 - so sorry I didn't get there earlier to convienience you.... it's not my problem that this is your job. The barmaid with tattoos and red hair gave us the most unpleasant service and resented our order and questions about the bar's drinks. In her mind, she was off the clock and ready to go home. Then the worst came afterwards when another bartender with the absolutely WORST ATTITUDE came to make the experience a memorable one. I forgot his name but he was short, stalky, had short black hair, a mustache, facial stubble, white skin, and very a round face. He attempted to argue with me about alcohol and where I come from, as if he knew better than me, and his his haughty arrogance was enough to make me write this review. He's a bad seed and made you lose my business. I did not even have one drink there, because I was so entirely put off by the whole experience. He was so rude!!!
author: Charlize Z.

description: Best Old-Fashioned in the city!
author: Belle G.

description: I wish every bar in San Francisco were as cool as Churchill. If my dog could write reviews, he'd say the same thing too.
author: Carlo A.

description: I was meeting up with friends after a date and kissed her goodbye on the corner before approaching the bar. I noticed the bartender watching us, and while he was checking my ID he made an inappropriate comment. I emailed Churchill the next day about this and never so much as received an acknowledgment email, let alone an apology. I won't be going back - there are a lot of other places around that are queer-friendly, and this is not one of them.
author: Laura R.

description: PLEASE, PLEASE, bartend is not a verb. Ya'll tend bar and yes you are Bartenders, but if you are literate you do not bartend. Just stop saying that!
author: Bryan R.

description: This is such a major upgrade from the past two venues AKA the Transfer and The BOC! We visited around 7pm on a Sunday and it was pretty empty, but still not dead. I had the home front cocktail which is a mix of Hangar One Straight, Dolin Blanc, Rosemary Syrup, Lemon, Soda and it`s served in a mason jar- love when things are served in mason jars yet I have no idea why I find it to be so enjoyable. Anyways, the drink was large, tasted great and was pretty strong so I walked out with a pleasant buzz. I really enjoyed the decor as well- great lighting, the ceiling is made of different shades of wood and looks great. I'd say the place has an urban shabby- chic look to it and I really dig the pool table too! I'll so definitely go back!
author: Natalie M.

description: We were parched and walked into the first bar we saw after hopping off the J-train. It was happy hour, so dollar off drinks and you can get a whiskey shot and beer for $9. They had some pretty good IPAs on tap too. Will re-visit the next time we are in town.
author: Mel C.

description: Love churchill. The bartenders are always friendly and quick. Not to mention they have my favorite drink in the city! Seriously, try the recoil. It is delicious. Maybe too delicious.
author: S S.

description: This is a great bar and space.  But the door person is rude.  He told some guys that were dressed in drag "sorry this is not that kind of bar".  WTF it is in the Castro area.  If they keep shit like that up they will be get a bad rap.  The bar has good mix or gay, straight, bi, whatever -- it's all good.  Don't be an asshole doorman.   If not for him, I would give the place a 5.
author: Darren I.

description: Came here last nite after our restaurant's big holiday party and it was super funn. The place was the perfect. There's an awesome amount of lounge seating, Ample bar space, lots of standing g hangout room and there's clean bathrooms to boot. There's a good selection of beer either on tap or by the bottle. They serve drinks in mason jars which coming from living in Santa Cruz for 6 years it was a real treat. The interior was pretty cool too! Lots of dark colors and cool lighting. The bar has ropes above that hang down like ceiling drapes. The drinks were fairly strong as I recall as well which although they were not cheap they weren't crazy expensive either and they were good. I wouldn't recommend grey hounds just from what I ordered but it could well have been a fluke. We stormed the place with like 60 people on a Tuesday nite so I'm sure they were kinda understaffed with just one bartender but he did a dam good job otherwise considering.
author: Harrison M.

description:
I walked by a few times and it looked cute so I decided to hold my Birthday party here this weekend. Anthony was super accommodating and was able to hold a table for all of us! 
Drinks were never a problem to get and the bartenders were very nice (as in not your usual 'hurry up and give me your drink order I have a bar of 100 people to serve")! Not to mention the drinks were DELICIOUS, not overly expensive and didn't all involve bourbon and an orange zest!! Love every thing about that place and will definitely be back!!
author: Allison N.

description: Visiting from Chicago and yes, I prefer beer. So if you're a typical impatient Chicagoan, don't expect quick service because SF is a cocktail town where it takes 10 minutes to make certain drinks. Otherwise, nice beer selection and yes, there is a great whiskey selection. Liked the crowd and the vibe of the place.
author: Michael H.

description: For whipping up my friend and I some incredible cocktails! Their jennie jerome drink was off the hook! Also, ambience was great ... Dark and sultry.
author: Brandon M.

description: So when I was served my beer in a mason jar, I didn't need any more convincing. i have an appreciation for hipster culture and associate mason jars with hipsters (maybe cuz I drank out of so many at the coops at berkeley?) Then i got to sit on a couch. and then i got to take a picture of the mason jars my friends and i were drinking out of and instagram that shiz. Very satisfied customer! can't wait to go back!
author: Cullen R.

description: i'm a fan!!!!!  Clean, new, woodsy, airy, strong cocktails made with fresh juice. Yum.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I'm told this bar has only been open for a week... but it felt like it was already a local hotspot (in the best of ways!). Woody, rustic, homey, dive-bar-esque, crowded but fairly spacious, with lots of seating options (thank you!!!) and a pool table in the back. It's like Rickhouse, but less dark and less snooty.  

Truth be told, however, I was pretty disappointed by the drinks, hence one star off... the wine tasted stale, the beer (the only amber they had) was biting in a decidedly abnormal way, and our friend's Whiskey Sour was more sour than whiskey. But hey, I'm willing to put that in the past as a one-time bad luck thing and would definitely be up for giving it a second shot. 

The second star off is for loudness (*this is me being picky*): the acoustics of the venue must be way off because it was unbearably loud at 1030pm on a bloody Wednesday evening. I don't know how it happened, but at one point I literally couldn't hear the person screaming in my ear next to me. Sure, there was a considerable crowd, but it wasn't remotely over-run or to the point of justifying such deafening noise levels. Not that it's particularly the owners' fault or even something that can be fixed.... it was just uncomfortable! 

Churchill doesn't necessarily bring anything new to the table and, consequently, doesn't entirely add much to the already happening Castro night scene but, overall, it is a fun and unassuming bar that is worth checking out if you haven't yet. I was not surprised to learn that the people who opened Churchill are veterans, because one week into the game, this bar already feels like it belongs.
author: G. J.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF.  Good drinks, good service, not too expensive, and a good location.  I like the layout, too.
author: Ryan S.

description: Reasonably priced drinks. Nice bartenders. Places to sit. Straight, Gay, Bi - they've got it all!
author: Aim E.

description: I'm not a "bar person," but this place was surprisingly good. Other than the fact that it was a bit loud for my tastes, the Old Fashioned I had was superb and the atmosphere was wonderful.
author: Andrew M.

description: Churchill is a great addition to the area, with good cocktails and a impressive beer selection.  The downsides are the constant crowd and prices that are higher than they should be at $9 per cocktail.  Still, it's nice to see this space now catering to everyone in the area instead of a single demographic group.
author: Joshua W.

description:
+ modern interior and exterior design. lots of cool details
+ a lot of places to sit
+ pool table
+ friendly bartender
+ good bloody mary
+ great beer selection
+ decent prices
author: Captain B.

description:
reasons I would go here:

1. Setting up a group Happy Hour on a weeknight
This place has good standing walking space and also great long tables for 8-10 people to hang around together.
4$ Happy Hour Beers is also a really nice plus

2. 1st bar on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday. 
This place is really chilled out, great central location and pretty easy to get to a drink, the bar isn't too crowded. Then you can head out to castro or lower haight or hayes.

3. Looking for delicious sipping drinks
the drinks are creative and pretty
author: Patrick D.

description: Small selection of microbrews, but they'll have some from a small obscure brewery.  The look of this place is very relaxing and a fun place to grab a few drinks with friends.
author: Don G.

description: This has to be my new favorite bar in the city.  Great location, not too busy, solid drinks, and a fantastic interior. I'll definitely be back!
author: Corey C.

description: Boring dull straight bar. like most of the bars in the mission ( think ) dried out Beachwood
author: Jay S.

description: Drinks take a moment so you had be ready to order as you're seen. Generally from what I have noticed there is a bartender almost solely dedicated for service bar and one for other guests so be sure to tip for their appropriated time not just the $1 for making the drink. There's a lot of love that goes into their specialty cocktails. I recommend Pim's Punch as far as group binge drinking goes. Otherwise Nemean Cup ( apple deliciousness rocks or Le Bonne Vie (basil refreshing). Not sure how happy works, but will certainly be making my rounds back again soon!
author: John P.

description: Churchill serves up some of the best cocktails in SF.  If you want a bomb cocktail without the pretentiousness of most "mixology" bars this is your place.  Go for the homestead to get your night started right.  Super friendly bar tenders, great drinks and vibe.
author: Scott L.

description: Great bar! I don't know about other nights, but I appreciated the 80's music on Saturday with a chill vibe. The bar can get a little crowded and it can be a hard to get in there to order one but they have a good selection of drinks. I appreciated the sihp decor, it gave it a bit of an East Coast vibe which was nice since that's where I'm from. Will be back for sure.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Ok, this is funny timing... I was just reminded of this bar today after disagreeing with a commenter on a Mission Mission blog that you will always receive good treatment from a bartender if you present the right etiquette and aren't a cheapskate tipper, etc... and the first review I see here insists that every single bartender at Churchill provides excellent customer service. 

I'm sorry to say that I have to disagree (I guess I should leave alone the sheer irony of leaving a Yelp review that claims all Yelp reviews are absolute crap written by complete morons, yes?? Hmmmm). Granted I have only been to Churchill once and only interacted with one bartender, but unless he has left the bar in the last few months or was just having an incredibly off night, I can say with complete certainty that there is at least one bartender at Churchill who does not fit the glowing description in the previous review. And to be honest he kind of ruined this bar for me.

This was my experience a few months ago when I went to meet some friends at Churchil:

1) Walk up to bar, adopt universal physical cues that I would like to order a drink (eye contact, lean forward, cash in hand), am entirely ignored by the bartender right in front of me who is too busy schoomzing and/or flirting with the dude next to me (who was not ordering) to help me. 

2) When bartender finally takes my order he sets it down and makes change without even the briefest of glances in my direction as he is still enthralled in conversation with my neighbor (see: rude).

3) When finished with first drink, order two vodka sodas (one for myself and one for my friend). Bartender's "friend" turns and asks, "Did you REALLY just order a vodka soda??" (Oh, I'M SORRY, HOW RUDE OF ME)

4) Receive only one vodka soda. Wait another 5-10 minutes at the bar for the other, cash displayed in hand, certain it must be coming...right...no? Bartender fails to either produce another drink or take the money for the first (or even look in my direction again).

5) I finally decide that a drink in the hand is better than two behind the bar since this bartender is clearly never going to bother to serve me, share the drink with my friend and get half of a vodka soda for free before leaving (hey, sometimes you just have to make the best of a situation).

Here's the thing: I've been to bars before when they're busy. I get it. There are few bartenders and many patrons. I understand having to wait my turn to get a drink when there are lots of people ordering drinks, especially if it's a place that specializes in those fancy-pants artisan cocktails and whatnot (YES, I UNDERSTAND BASIC LOGIC, THANK YOU). But... it was not that busy. This bartender wasn't running around making drinks or taking orders. He was seriously just standing there a few feet away from me shooting the breeze with someone. That's rude and that is terrible customer service. 

And while I can't really hold the bartender's chat buddy's snarky comments on my drink choice against him (I couldn't help but assume he was thinking the same thing though...hmm) it just added to the pretentious atmosphere I was starting to feel exuding from the establishment. I mean, for the love of god, I like a hoity-toity gin cocktail with 4 types of liquor I've never heard of and rare wildflowers picked from the southern edge of the Himalayas as much as the next person but sometimes a girl just wants to keep it simple and drink a freaking vodka soda, man!!! And I for one would like to be able to order one without the bartender acting like I'm wasting his time and putting him out terribly. I mean, if you're going to be snobby about drink orders at least be witty about it like Bourbon & Branch and advertise freely that you'll get the boot for ordering a Cosmo (no I don't know for sure if it's true, I don't drink Cosmos...duh).

Because I don't feel right basing my ENTIRE review on the bad taste (not literally, since I did at least get two thirds of the vodka sodas I ordered) a sole bartender left in my mouth, I'm giving one star for decor and aesthetics, one for an interesting, tasty-sounding drink menu, and one for general potential. Although to be honest, if I'm in the neighborhood again I'm far more likely to just go around the corner to Blackbird instead.
author: Aimee M.

description: 5 stars because I see no room for improvement (in my experience). Spacious, decently crowded, easy to get a drink, large drink selection, friendly bartenders, reasonable crowd and easily accessible from my house. Perfect for grabbing a drink after work with a friend or two. If you are in the neighborhood (or even if you're not) you should probably stop in and check it out.
author: Shanna T.

description: I love this new place! Drinks are spectacular! Location is perfect.. Can't wait for next drinking event.. I'm there!
author: Monica S.

description: Beware. The bartenders will blame you if someone stole your card and put a huge tip on it. Be careful if you decide to give them your card to keep a tab open.
author: Alex D.

description: The prices are pretty steep as far as mixed drinks go, but the mason jars are a lovely touch. I ordered off the menu, and was pleasantly surprised! The bartender made me a Paloma, it was a little to bitter at first, so he adjusted it for me and it was wonderful! I really enjoyed the crowd, and the fact that it wasn't too loud.
author: T M.

description: I love this place!! I've been here on a busy Saturday night ( get there early!!) and a laid back mid day Sunday. They've a lounging area but always taken during the night of course...i like the pool table but they've only one. Better than none!! The bathrooms are really clean and unique style. You don't have to wait long for a drink. My favorite is homefront that they serve drinks out of Mason Jars!!!
author: Julie K.

description: I'm very impressed how they converted a dumpy bar (BOC) which I grew to love into a lounge that I could go to everyday. I think this place is a great alternative to the other local bar blackbird. Nice interiors and a great upscale atmosphere
author: Kevin L.

description: Perfect for group gatherings. It is very inviting and they make GREAT drinks and they are served in mason jars! The only thing about this place is the line! YES we were there on Sat and had to stand in line forever to get in!!! ugh! annoying so if ur planning on checking this place get there early!
author: Kajal P.

description: This bar is a great representation of San Francisco. Strong, creative, tasty drinks that are prepared by knowledgeable mixologists. Sexy people. Great variety of music. I will definitely be coming back here. My drink = The Southsider.
author: Ryan B.

description: I'm a sucker for a cocktail in a mason jar.  And I LOVE the decor: moody without being pretentious, historic without being contrived.  Great music, great crowd.  I think I'm in love.
author: Kelsie M.

description: The bartenders were SO nice to me and my girls... despite the fact that we were kinda the loudest most obnoxious group in there. It was my friend's b-day and they took it upon themselves to bring over special (delicious!) shots for all of us and joined in. It probably helped that it wasn't crowded.  We left a mess of flower petals and goldfish and they didn't pull that bitter, put out attitude that oh so many service industry professionals tend to pull (at the end of what I'm sure was a long, arduous weekend). They saw us off with well wishes and a smile. Thanks guys! I'll be back.
author: Alexa S.

description: It goes without saying the space is absolutely beautiful, even the bathroom is well designed. The ideal time to come is right around when they open, at about 3-4pm or possibly even for happy hour after work. I haven't dared come at night as I am sure it gets very packed. Their beer selection is impressive for a cocktail oriented bar but their mixed drinks are superb. Try the bees knees for a fresh lemon libation or the home front which is ridiculously refreshing with hints of rosemary. I'm sure their bourbon drinks are just as good as the ones I've had at Bloodhound. You also can't go wrong ordering a Pimms cup, so few bars carry Pimms now a days. They also take cards, which is one of very few bars in the Castro that does, but I can't imagine paying for several drinks at ~$8-9 a pop with just cash.
author: Cori W.

description:
Chill, pleasant atmosphere...long wraparound bar makes for more space for barside chats. Eclectic crowd...not any particular stereotype.

Good service, good prices.
author: Lina L.

description: Love this place! I love the design of the interiors. I would not call it a dive bar though- it's casual and relaxed but they have put way more into this place than what you find at a run down dive bar. I wish they took credit cards without a $20 minimum but that's the city I guess. My only gripe- I'm trying to contact them through their website for a private party inquiry and it's not working.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I knew if Churchill was to live up to their hype, I would hear from management after my negative review: and boy did I. I received a warm, apologetic and humble response to my review from Anthony (owner and managing partner at Churchill), and I wholeheartedly accept their apology.

I don't like to hold grudges, as when the-ish goes down, all I really wanted want is an apology (so everyone can move on and just be happy). And that's what I got!

I can't retract my review, because well, it is a masterpiece (at your expense, Churchill), but I do know people make mistakes, and if they are sorry, I accept that!

Even though incidents like my 1st review shouldn't happen in the first place, I do appreciate this great show of customer service to remedy this rouge bartender.

Thanks again for the response! I'll see you soon, Anthony!
author: Jeffrey G.

description: GREAT SERVICE! BARTENDERS FANTASTIC! Intend to let everyone know about this place. If you want to experience a mixed group of people gathered in one place to have a good time, this should be the first place to stop at.
author: Ryel O.

description:
i love this place, SO much. 

starting with the lovely door men - they are all quite nice and friendly which is a wonderful departure from many other places in the city.  the bar itself is designed for tons of people to have somewhere to sit and enjoy their drink.  the bartenders are the best in the city - proper shout outs to Vanessa and Carly, those gals are amaze.  also, Anthony is a gem.  this is by far my favorite bar in the city, they can have all my money.  and the jukebox rules.
author: Rose K.

description: Love this bar! Sophisticated bartenders without the overbearing attitude. "Hi can I get a cosmo"? "Yes you may, what kind of Vodka would you like"? This may seem like no big deal, but I have been laughed at by bartenders at other establishments for ordering my favorite girly cocktail. Aside from being able to get the drink you want, this place is really cool and busy. Fun atmosphere to meet new people, very diverse crowd. It gets busy on weekend nights, and can take a few minutes to get a drink, but its well worth it once you do.
author: Mindy C.

description: Hip and fun. My bartender spent time making me a creative non-alcoholic drink that tasted great. Kinda too loud to chat easily but that's the deal around these parts. Decor is great - lath on  the ceiling is a classy touch.
author: ari s.

description: They make a good Sazerac which for me is a high bench mark.
author: Erich V.

description: Create a bar and the people will come. Market & Church has been needing Churchill for awhile. It's been through so many turnovers. I'm happy to say that the drink selection is great. I really like the layout of the place. The interior and exterior are done up really nicely. It's feels like a very mixed crowd too. The bar is the best place to sit cause it's nice to watch the bartenders make all the drinks.
author: Mei F.

description: Last Friday after work, I needed some "therapy"...luckily, a friend answered the call and suggested we meet at Churchill for some drinks. He told me that it was a newly opened bar and as soon as we walked in, I immediately liked the decor and vibe at Churchill. However, it was really busy so it was a bit of a wait for us to get our drinks but I know how it is based on being a bartender myself before. I would definitely come back here again!
author: Barbra C.

description: The lame bartenders and weak drinks ruin the cool vibe and great location of Churchill. The bartenders obviously have no clue they are there for their customers. While its not hard to get a drink, the staff make you wish you had to wait a little longer. They're full of attitude and not very helpful. And my expectations are typically pretty low when it comes to bars. The crowd, however, is a great mix of gay and straight...and I love the ceiling.
author: Eric M.

description: Bartenders are douches and dumb. No etiquette and customer service needs a revamp. Thank god for The Residence!!! Bar etiquette approved!!!
author: R R.

description: So glad I happened across this place. I'd heard some good things but the reality is much better. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. Drink selection is great - the decor is fun and inviting. Great vibe - I will definitely be back.
author: prior O.

description: This place has potential.. stopped in for a quick drink yesterday and (predictably) the place was swarming with people (and hipsters) since it's brand new.  I recommend the Brooklyn, their version of a Manhattan.  While I'm getting tired of paying $9 for a specialty cocktail, it packed quite the punch.
author: Toby C.

description: I like Sazeracs. They're as old fashioned as the Old Fashioned, but heaven forbid you ask some bartenders for one. They won't know what it is or might need a reminder or need step by step instructions. Here you can ask for one with the confidence that they'll know what it is and make it a good one. Accessible by public transit and in a fairly central area. Not a gay bar but it's close to some if you want to barhop into the Castro.
author: Diana O.

description: Fantastic cocktails as expected. Drinks are nicely served in the Bloodhound-esque jars. Yum. Cheers to the Brooklyn! (Churchill's twist to the Manhattan).
author: Peter T.

description: New place near my neighborhood, owned by the same people that opened Bloodhound in SOMA (which I love) and Double dutch. Chill spot with beer and full bar! Only time will tell if this will be a new go-to spot in my hood.
author: Alana L.

description: Venue is rustic and lovely. Drinks were sub par. I ordered a more fruity drink off the menu and it tasted horrible. After asking the bartender to sweeten it up, it still tasted bad so I had an old fashioned which was good. This is a place that would be fun to come with a  big group because it is so open. Probably won't come back here because the drinks were disappointing but the barstaff was really nice at least!
author: Rachel S.

description: 8pm, and everyone was wasted. Not just a little. I even witnessed a young drunk 20 something take a hit of some bum's something and she said, "No big deal right?" This would be a failure of her friends not watching her. After that I was uneasy and Left. I felt dirty, so I went home and took a shower.
author: Star Z.

description: Went last night and really enjoy the space. Bartenders are very nice. They even took back the cocktail I couldn't drink and swapped it out for another one (which was MUCH better).  The decor is lovely, the crowd isn't very scene-y at all, the bathrooms are GREAT! Biggest drawback - it's LOUD. Really loud. I mean REALLY loud.
author: EE C.

description: I liked the atmosphere here.  Good mix of people, pool table in the back.  But if I wanted to drink straight orange juice I wouldn't have ordered a tequila sunrise.  I'm not sure there was any alcohol in the drink at all.
author: Marie B.

description: Bulleit bourbon cocktail on the menu. Trendy wood decor. Sofas that I would want in my apartment.
author: Jose C.

description: Stopped by Churchill last night for a cocktail and was not disappointed. From the decor to the classic cocktails, this bar lives up to its buzz. Looked like a lot of the patrons were sipping affordable draft beer from mason jars, but since I'm a big fan of 1940s-era-inspired cocktails I decided to order the Monte Carlo ($9). Let's just say I'll be returning soon to sample the other offerings.
author: Nancy P.

description: Wanted to like this place, went back twice just to make sure. 1) wait staff are effing rude...I'm talking snapping fingers in my friend's face, giving me shit for adding one more beer to my order...effing RUDE (it's not like I'm paying you for your service, right?). 2) they rounded my credit card bill up by $4 after I signed (I think that's theft). So yeah, the overdone mason jars are cute, and it's a good location, but the staff need to GET OVER THEMSELVES!
author: Pui Lum W.

description: Great local bar. Finally something in my neighborhood.
author: john m.

description: I'm sorry, this place could be cool, but the bartender Anthony does NOT know what's up.  He  doesn't even know what Fernet Branca is....and then he tries to charge a DOUCHE TAX about it!  I came here for the specific purpose of taking a Frenet shot to celebrate a great occasion.  And he said they didn't have it.  Conveniently it appeared behind his head less than 2 minutes later, and we had already disheartedly ordered beers instead.  So when we see it, we ask to switch out our beers for his mistake and do that Frenet shot we came there for...guess what?  Douche tax!  upcharge if we want to switch out for his mistake.  Anthony, learn your drinks.  And learn how to deal with customers!
author: Rockin' D.

description: 48 star usa flag adorning one of the walls, framed. adds to a rad overall decor. also, drink a Farewell to Arms, or maybe two. Tasty.
author: Sean B.

description: kinda has a '90s miami vice feel to bar with the back light, rumor is that they wanted a "straight bar" in the hood, but i heart lesbians tho.
author: Pickle R.

description: reasonably priced, and delicious, cocktails, bartenders without attitude, comfortable, and walking distance for me.  except for the occasional line to get in on weekend nights, this is my new hang.
author: Sara J.

description: Great new bar.  The new owners did wonders with the mess that was Bar on Church.  The drinks are unique and tasty, the service is quick, and the crowd is fun.
author: Garrett H.

description: Great bar.  I really like the feel, and there's an area with sofas and chairs where you can chill and enjoy your drink with friends.  Definitely a place I will come back to again!
author: Sam W.
